intro: Dombeya ivohibeensis subsp. ivohibeensis, commonly known as the Ivohibeensis Dombeya, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in humid, forested areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and endemic status.
